awd_titl_txt: Travel: Support for Conference Participation at the ACM Conference on Intelligent User Interfaces 2023
awd_abstract_narration:
This award will support student attendance at the 2023 version of the Intelligent User Interfaces (IUI) conference to be held in Sydney, Australia.  IUI is the main international conference where researchers in human computer interaction (HCI) and artificial intelligence (AI) present work on systems that use AI to help people be more effective in interacting with computers.  IUI research spans a wide range of socially important topics and domains, including recommender systems, adaptive educational systems, accessibility, autonomous systems, creativity, virtual agents, and many others.  Providing travel funding that allows junior researchers to present their own work and be enriched by others' work will strengthen the IUI community and provide valuable benefits for the students involved. 

The funding will support around 12 students, some in person and some virtually, to attend the conference.  Most of these students will also attend a Doctoral Consortium at which later-stage PhD students will present and get feedback on their dissertation research from both senior researchers and other PhD students in the IUI community.  The availability of travel funding will be widely announced in the relevant communities, with students being invited to submit applications describing their doctoral work.  These applications will be reviewed by a program committee that gives substantive feedback for every application, whether accepted or not.  Acceptance decisions will be made with an eye toward topical, institutional, and demographic diversity of participants, while also considering financial need.  Chosen students will attend a day-long doctoral consortium, have additional opportunities to meet with individual mentors, and be invited to present in a poster session for the conference.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
Objectives: This project aimed to fund students from U.S. institutions to present their work at the ACM Conference on Intelligent User Interfaces (IUI 2023), to be held in Sydney, Australia at Mar 27-31, 2023. The travel support is expected to assist students enrolled in Ph.D. programs in the US who had funding difficulties towards conference attendance. Remaining grants will also be available for students enrolled in graduate and/or undergraduate programs in the US. The remaining balance in 2023 was reused to support student attendance to ACM IUI 2024 which was held in Greenville, SC, USA during Mar 18-21, 2024. 


Outcomes: This grant was utilized to support 13 students (4/13 were female students) and 2 students (2/2 were females) to attend the ACM IUI 2023 (in Sydney, Australia) and 2024 (in Greenville, USA) conferences, respectively. Students were given the opportunity to attend an international conference, present their dissertation research in oral sessions and in a poster session, receive feedback from the community at large, interact with senior researchers and peers, and become embedded into the research community.


Intellectual Merit: The Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) community has been well-developed, and the joint effort of HCI and artificial intelligence (AI) has been influential various areas of applications, including (but is in no way limited to) recommender systems, adaptive educational systems, intelligent user interfaces, e-commerce, advertising, digital humanities, social networks, personalized health, entertainment, applications oriented to users with different disabilities, and many more. ACM IUI is where the HCI community meets the AI community. ACM IUI an annual meeting of the intelligent interfaces community and serves as a premier international forum for reporting outstanding research and development on intelligent user interfaces. Active participation of young researchers in this conference is very important for the health of the field and for the researchers themselves. Thus, by bringing young and creative researchers to the IUI conferences, the requested funds will help advance an important and socially valuable research field.  


Broader Impact: This activity supports the mission of NSF and other granting agencies to train more advanced professionals in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM). Attending conferences is difficult and expensive for students. Funding travel for graduate students has a broader impact. In past years at the IUI conferences, students presented their research to the larger community, spoke individually with leaders in the field, and received strong support by articulating their research and receiving feedback. Many of these conversations continued during the year and beyond. Thus, the funding provided by NSF will have a significant impact to the careers of the future generation of researchers in the field of user modeling, user-centered computing, and other related fields by allowing them to attend and present their work at IUI, the premier conference of the field. This will lead to the next generation of IUI researchers, striving to develop futuristic user-centered computing that can improve productivity, performance, and satisfaction of society at large.

Modified by: Yong Zheng
